sections.text: Loss caused by fortuitous eventWhen the thing lent is damaged by a fortuitous event from which the borrower could have protected the thing lent by using a thing of his own or, when being unable to preserve both things, the borrower chose to preserve a thing of his own, he is liable for the damage to the thing lent.Acts 2004, No. 743, ยง1, eff. Jan. 1, 2005.
